intro: Anisochilus carnosus var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-flowered anisochilus, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family, characterized by its fern-like appearance. It is a terrestrial, epiphytic or lithophytic plant, often found growing on rocks or tree trunks in humid environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive purplish hue, especially along the veins. Its reproductive structures are small and clustered, typical of many ferns. It thrives in shaded, moist conditions and is often associated with tropical and subtropical regions.
